title: UK to Sign Pacific Trade Deal, Shifting Focus to China
description: The UK is set to sign a Pacific trade deal in Auckland next weekend, formally becoming the first new member since the framework came into force, and shifting attention to a list of other applicant countries headed by China.

title: Republican 2024 Hopeful Scott Confident He Will Make Debate Cut
description: Republican presidential hopeful Tim Scott expressed confidence that he will meet his party’s eligibility requirements to participate in the cycle’s first debate in August.

title: Trump Blasted by Former CIA Chief Over Classified Documents in New Political Ad
description: Donald Trump “must face consequences” for mishandling classified documents, former Central Intelligence Director Michael Hayden said in a new political ad that’s another indication of the degree to which the former president’s legal troubles will dominate the 2024 campaign.

title: Some Cracks Are Starting to Show in the US Job Market
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy reporter Reade Pickert digs deeper into today’s jobs report. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Donald Trump Blasts Ron DeSantis on Important Issue to Iowa Voters: Ethanol
description: Former President Donald Trump went after his main rival for the Republican presidential nomination Friday on an issue of out-sized importance to Iowa caucus voters: the federal ethanol mandate.

title: Biden to Purchase 6 Million More Barrels of Oil for Emergency Reserve
description: The Biden administration announced Friday it’s purchasing 6 million more barrels of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve as it continues to slowly refill the emergency stockpile.

title: Trump’s Lingering Appeal Over Pence’s Jan. 6 Testimony Dismissed
description: A federal appeals court tossed out what remained of Donald Trump’s unsuccessful legal fight to stop his former vice president-turned-rival Mike Pence from testifying about efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

title: NATO Pledges to Spend at Least 2% of GDP on Defense
description: NATO allies have agreed to a new pledge to spend at least 2% of GDP on defense, firming up the alliance’s previous goal to “move toward the 2% guideline.”

title: US Will Send Cluster Bombs to Ukraine Despite Civilian Threat
description: The US said it will send cluster bombs to Ukraine as part of a new push to support the country’s counteroffensive and boost its dwindling stocks of ammunition, overruling concerns that the weapons often fail to explode and pose a grave danger to civilians.

title: Dutch Cabinet Falls Abruptly After Disagreement on Asylum Policy
description: The fourth cabinet of Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte abruptly fell over migration crisis, according to news outlet NOS.

title: Congressman Gallego Takes Paternity Leave After Daughter’s Birth
description: Arizona Democrat Ruben Gallego has a newborn daughter and wants the world to know he is taking a break from a fiercely competitive campaign to oust an incumbent senator so he can spend time with her.

title: US Cluster Bombs Risk Russian War Escalation, Lula Adviser Says
description: President Joe Biden’s plan to send cluster munitions to Ukraine is dangerous for civilians and risks escalating war with nuclear-armed Russia, according to Brazil’s most prominent foreign policy official.

title: Rudy Giuliani Should Lose Law License for 2020 Election Case, Panel Says
description: Rudy Giuliani should lose his law license in Washington for directing former President Donald Trump’s failed legal challenge to the 2020 presidential election results in Pennsylvania, an attorney ethics review panel has recommended.

title: France’s Boone Says Daily Life Is Back to Normal After Riots
description: France’s minister for European affairs, Laurence Boone, said calm has returned to the country after riots triggered by the police shooting of a teenager in a Paris suburb 10 days ago.

title: Former Council on Foreign Relations Chief Defends Russia Meetings
description: The former chief of the Council on Foreign Relations, Richard Haass, confirmed he was part of a group that met with Russia’s foreign minister in April, saying such talks are important when official negotiations are “either nonexistent or unproductive.”

title: Japan Seeks Enhanced NATO Engagement in Asia During Key Summit
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida will seek to enhance ties with members of NATO during a key summit in Lithuania next week as the defense alliance seeks to deepen cooperation with like-minded countries to counter Russia and keep an eye on China.

title: Trump Special Counsel Spent $5.4 Million Probing Former President So Far
description: Special Counsel Jack Smith spent $5.4 million on staff compensation and other expenses in his first four months leading two criminal investigations involving former President Donald Trump.

title: Erdogan Says Turkey Can’t Trust Sweden as ‘Terrorists’ Roam Free
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan rebuffed calls from NATO allies to quickly ratify Sweden’s membership in the military alliance, saying his country can’t trust a country where “terrorists roam free in its streets.”

title: Ukraine Plans to Seize Sense Bank From Russian Billionaires Soon
description: Ukraine plans to nationalize Sense Bank, one of the country’s systemically important lenders, from its Russian owners as early as next week, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Turkey Hikes Taxes, Fees to Pay for Spending Pledges, Quake Toll
description: Turkey raised a swathe of taxes and fees to boost the government’s income as it tries to fulfill election spending promises and rebuild a region devastated by earthquakes.

title: US Accuses Russia of Interfering With Drone Missions in Syria
description: The US military accused Russia of using fighter jets and flares to repeatedly disrupt its drone missions in Syria, moves it says risk provoking an escalation of conflict in the war-torn country.

title: Chinese Foreign Minister’s Unusual 12-Day Absence Draws Scrutiny
description: Chinese Foreign Minister Qin Gang has been absent from public view for 12 days, an usual absence for the normally-busy senior official.

title: War in Ukraine Exposes the Paradox of Poland
description: War often makes for strange bedfellows.

title: Philippines Cancels $1 Billion in Farmers’ Debt to Lift Output
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Friday signed into law an agrarian reform measure that writes off nearly 58 billion pesos ($1.04 billion) of debts owed by farmers to help them boost production.

title: Ukraine Finance Chief Sees Urgent Need for War-Risk Insurance
description: Ukraine’s wartime defense spending will remain high next year, underscoring the need for allies to provide war-risk insurance to help attract investment, the nation’s finance minister said.

title: Biden Takes Steps to Lower Health-Care Costs With New Rules on Medical Bills, Insurance
description: President Joe Biden will announce steps his administration is taking to help lower health care costs, including the targeting of so-called junk insurance plans and surprise medical bills, part of an effort to rein in high prices for consumers that have been a persistent political liability.

title: EU Says Cost of Sanctions Will Hit Russia Harder Over Time
description: The European Union’s sanctions against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine will build over time and will have a growing long-term impact on Moscow’s economy.

title: Ukraine Recap: Zelenskiy to Turkey After EU Deal on Ammunition
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is scheduled to meet Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Friday, according to officials familiar with the plan, as the expiration date of the Black Sea grain deal approaches.

title: Yellen Says US Doesn’t Want ‘Winner Take All’ Fight With China
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said competition between the world’s biggest economies is not a “winner-take-all” situation, and called for both sides to manage their rivalry with a fair set of rules.

title: AIIB Says It Found No Evidence of Undue Influence on Decisions
description: The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank said an internal review found no evidence of undue influence on decision-making after a former employee said China’s Communist Party dominated the institution.

title: India Court Declines to Stay Rahul Gandhi Defamation Conviction
description: An Indian court refused to suspend Rahul Gandhi’s conviction in a defamation case, a setback for the opposition leader who’s at risk of being unable to contest national elections due in the first half of 2024.

title: Populist or Hero of War in Ukraine: Who is Poland’s Andrzej Duda?
description: The invasion of Ukraine propelled Poland’s president from the periphery of European politics to the center, but he might have blown his chance of staying there

title: Sunak Seeks to Cut Number of Britons Claiming ‘Unfit to Work’
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is looking to reduce the ranks of Britons declared too sick to work and boost the economy by reforming the system of “fit notes” issued by doctors.

title: Vietnam PM Seeks Looser Policy Settings to Spur Slowing Economy
description: Vietnam’s Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh has doubled down on his calls for a “more flexible” monetary policy to support businesses as the government worries it may miss this year’s economic growth target.

title: South Korean Panel Backs Japan’s Fukushima Wastewater Discharge Plan
description: A South Korean government panel backed Japan’s plans to release treated wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear disaster site, a move that could ease tension with Tokyo yet stoke public concern.

title: US Raises Fresh Concern Over China’s ‘Risky’ Sea Moves
description: The US has expressed concern over China’s recent behavior towards Philippine vessels in the South China Sea, with Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin calling Beijing’s move “coercive and risky.”

title: Brazil Congress Advances First Major Tax Overhaul in Decades
description: Brazil’s lower house gave preliminary approval to a proposal to overhaul the country’s labyrinthine tax rules, a goal that has eluded lawmakers in South America’s largest nation for decades.

title: Biden Administration Argues to Pause Social Media Contact Ban
description: The Biden administration said a court order barring some federal agencies and officials from communicating with social media companies is overbroad and “ambiguous,” and asked a judge to pause it while the government appeals.
